internal.content: --- title: "Create The Turbonomic Instance" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 152 --- ## üöÄ STEP: Create the Turbonomic Instance üåè Documentation for the Task: Create the Turbonomic Instance (Start at Step 5.) In this section you will deploy¬†a Turbonomic¬†Instance into your Cluster using the Operator installed in the previous section. 1. Click on `Turbonomic Platform Operator` ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/09_turbo.png) 2. On the Turbonomic Operator page you have all the relevant information for the Operator. Click `Create Instance` ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/10_turbo.png) 4. You could specify all the parameters in the Form View, but for convenience, switch to the YAML view. Click on `YAML View` ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/11_turbo.png) 4. Paste the code below into the YAML code field, overwriting the existing content ```yaml apiVersion: charts.helm.k8s.io/v1 kind: Xl metadata: name: xl-release namespace: turbonomic spec: webhook: enabled: true servicenow: enabled: true websphere: enabled: true jvm: enabled: true actionscript: enabled: true xen: enabled: false mysql: enabled: true global: customImageNames: false repository: registry.connect.redhat.com/turbonomic storageClassName: ibmc-block-gold storageSelector: false tag: 8.7.5 tomcat: enabled: true netapp: enabled: true hyperflex: enabled: true ucs: enabled: true udt: enabled: true mssql: enabled: true nutanix: enabled: true weblogic: enabled: false hyperv: enabled: true vcenter: enabled: true hpe3par: enabled: true oneview: enabled: true vmax: enabled: true instana: enabled: true azure: enabled: true actionstream-kafka: enabled: false scaleio: enabled: false wmi: enabled: true newrelic: enabled: true gcp: enabled: true appdynamics: enabled: true vmm: enabled: true jboss: enabled: true pure: enabled: true ibmstorage-flashsystem: enabled: true horizon: enabled: true appinsights: enabled: true dynatrace: enabled: true aws: enabled: true openshiftingress: enabled: true snmp: enabled: true oracle: enabled: true kubeturbo: enabled: true prometheus: enabled: true prometurbo: enabled: true ``` 4. The result should look like this. Click on `Create` ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/13_turbo.png) 4. Click on `Create` ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/14_turbo.png) ## Create ClusterRolesBindings 1. Open your Openshift Web Console 1. Click on the `+` in the upper right corner ![image](./../images/prereqs/01_prereqs.png) 1. Copy and paste the following code ```yaml kind: ClusterRoleBinding apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 metadata: name: turbonomic-admin1 subjects: - kind: ServiceAccount name: t8c-operator namespace: turbonomic roleRef: apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io kind: ClusterRole name: cluster-admin --- kind: ClusterRoleBinding apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 metadata: name: turbonomic-admin2 subjects: - kind: ServiceAccount name: turbo-user namespace: turbonomic roleRef: apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io kind: ClusterRole name: cluster-admin --- kind: ClusterRoleBinding apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 metadata: name: turbonomic-admin2 subjects: - kind: ServiceAccount name: default namespace: turbonomic roleRef: apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io kind: ClusterRole name: cluster-admin ``` 4. Click `Create` ## Follow Installation Progress 1. Click on `Workloads/Pods` ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/16_turbo.png) 1. Make sure you have selected the `turbonomic` Project ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/17_turbo.png) 1. Sort by `Ready` column ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/18_turbo.png) 1. Wait for all Pods to have `1/1` Status. ![turbo](./../images/turbonomic/19_turbo.png) **Important - Installation takes some time** Installation can take 10-30 minutes, just ignore error states like `CrashLoopBackOff`. If after 30 minutes there are still errors, please check with your instructor. You have successfully finished this Chapter. **You are now done with the chapter on Installing Turbonomic** Please continue to the next chapter to learn how to Configure Turbonomic.
